dialogues.text: Goddamnit! (she answers) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, this is the attendance office at Blue Bay School.  Your son or daughter is absent today, Monday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up hard.  Sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra waves him off.  She pulls on a T-shirt, then grabs phone once more, punching in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desk, files, a terrarium full of swamp lizards, above whi photo of the Windward Passage decorates the wall.  There' Waterford bowl on the desk -- etched with "Sam Lombardo - Bay Educator of the Year." Sam is working on the computer.  The PHONE RINGS.  He ans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counseling.

dialogues.speaker: XNTERCUT
dialogues.text: Sandra seated on the bed, one long leg tucked beneath her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Sandy Van Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's eyes go cold when he hears the word "Sam." In his office, Sam pushes himself away from the computer, stiffening noticeably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy... What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Kelly skipped school.  Have you talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Here we go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you see her this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth, I haven't seen her since Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM -- A SHOTGUN BLASTS outside Sandra's window.  She ju BOOM, BOOM -- more BLASTS.  She jumps up to look outside.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: stands at the edge of the bay, launching skeet then blast high above the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  I found her. (a long beat) Listen, Sam.  It was good seeing you the other day. (beat) I haven't found anyone else can handle the Jonathan like you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at Frankie -- who has heard enough.  He gives long hard look, then rolls from the bed to walk from the Sam remains silent, watching the lizards with their blank unblinking eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  I know you're seeing Barbara Baxter.  So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe I'm a one-woman man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) You really think you're gonna get one of these Blue Bay women to marry you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra pauses to laugh once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab a clue, Sam.  You're a hired hand around here.  Enjoy it while it lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sandra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam puts down the phone, looks at it -- a long moment as barest hint of a smile plays upon his face. Sandra slams down her phone.  She looks to the bay, to th racing sloop floating beyond the private dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nerve of some people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOTGUN BLASTS away.  Kelly pauses to reload.  She ca sight of... Sandra, approaching from the main house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to find guns therapeutic. Maybe I oughta try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly lets the gun's barrel drift over Sandra, then turns away.  She moves toward the guest house.  A used-brick co tucked among the gnarled branches and roots of a huge ban tree.  Sandra follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, some boy didn't call and screwed up the weekend.  So you're taking the day off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks toward the main house, in time to see... Frankie walk from the bedroom and dive into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of your "bodyguards" is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whichever one I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly turns away, starts for the guest house once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN to REVEAL room -- the gun case, the animal trophies, photos -- One of a stately old gentleman in an elaborate chair, a cane at his side, a bowler on his knee.  Others and a handsome middle-aged man in safari gear, posing wit rifles above slain wildebeests and bison. Sandra and Kelly ENTER.  Kelly puts down the shotgun, tur tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You notice my new jumper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly does a three-sixty, like a model on a runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends buy me clothes, so I don't look like trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would hardly say you look like trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the bed.  Sandra moves to stand over her, ang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come off of it. (a beat) You run with all these little trust fund brats... They think money grows on trees.  It doesn't.  Believe me.  And a lot of your little friends are gonna learn that one the hard way. (beat) I'm trying to spare you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly goes to one shoulder on the bed, sobbing now.  Her continues to stand over her, suddenly more perplexed than

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly.  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. (a long beat) Well, I do too, sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have to kill himself, Kelly. He could have gone out and gotten a job. Christ, he could've found another rich woman... He never had a problem tucking my friends when we were married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses as Kelly cries all the harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why he did it.  I really don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails away, as meanwhile Kelly has drawn herse into a fetal position on the bed.  The sobbing has stoppe her shoulders continue to shake.  Sandra sits on the edge bed, reaches over to rub Kelly's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shakes her head, no. Her mother looks at her, clearly at a loss.  At last she She is headed out of the room when Kelly says something, words are indistinct, as her fists are pressed against he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, honey?  I can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long beat as Kelly collects herself.  She star the wall, her eyes filled with tears, but when she speaks enunciates each word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said.  I was raped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra looks as if she has been struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raped. (a long beat) By Sam Lombardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra moves over to the bed, sits once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... Sam Lombardo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  God, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly begins to cry.  Sandra pulls her upright, cradling her arms, eyes on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Spanish-style building sits before a neat square o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter does not get raped in Blue Bay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra slams a fist on the conference table. Kelly is seated between her mother and her mother's attor BAXTER.  Baxter sports an Italian suit and a lethal Alexa Haig look. Seated across from these three are Ray, Gloria and BRYCE the local D.A. Silence follows Sandra's outburst.  Baxter reaches to squ Sandra's shoulder.  Kelly puts her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a quiet voice) You're saying that Kelly was raped by Sam Lombardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Gloria exchange looks.  Gloria in particular look slightly stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guidance counselor at Blue Bay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) The guidance counselor at Blue Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand your feelings, Ms. Van Ryan.  But please, we'd like some time with Kelly.  We'd like to take her statement alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter nods, yes.  Sandra looks at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man must be insane to think he can do this to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Baxter takes her by the arm as Ray CROSSES the room t the door.  Bryce Hunter walks out with then. Gloria takes a seat closer to Kelly.  When she speaks, sh very calm and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Kelly? Would you like to take a break for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I just want to get it over with.  My mom's making me do this. I just want to forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits as Ray sets up a camera on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to videotape the statement if that's all right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is not pleasant, Kelly.  But these are serious charges and we need to know everything that happened between you and Mr. Lombardo. (beat) Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started rubbing my shoulders.  Said must be sore after washing cars.  I... let him  I mean he's a nice guy. (beat) I don't know... It was so fast.  I closed my eyes.  I remember his hands moved to my breasts.  I mean just for a second it was nice... I forgot whore I was.  I mean he's so gorgeous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, Gloria and Bryce Hunter stand at one end of the long conference table, watching the playback of Kelly's tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next thing... his hand was in my shorts... you know, from behind.  His fingers... his fingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were in me.  Both places... you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said something like, "Do you want it dirty7" or something. (beat) I tried to turn away, but he pushed me to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there penetration?  Did he put himself inside you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I said stop.  I screamed.  I mean that's how it sounded in my head.  He hurt me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Kelly breaks into tears) That's okay, Kelly.  You're doing fine. (beat) But I have to ask you something here. When you say it hurt.  Was this the first time a man was inside you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I've done it a couple of times, I mean with guys I dated.  But this hurt... like, he was built... you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was large?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods, starts to break down again, then holds it off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try to fight him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... he had my wrists pinned behind me. I remember my hands were cold.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kept saying, "Let it happen, let it happen."  Then he just stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he withdrew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at first.  He was still inside but he wasn't moving or anything...  He said we had this secret.  And that now he'd be able to help me... because we were close... Something like that.  I don't know.  It's hard to remember, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know one thing he said.  It was when... when he took himself out and was standing up. (beat) He said, "Don't worry, I didn't come." I can't forget that.  He said, "No little girl can ever make me come."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape is paused -- FREEZES on Kelly's face ON SCREEN. BACK TO RAY, GLORIA & HUNTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "No little girl can ever make me come." Jesus.  Too bad.  We might have some physical evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Gloria stare at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It feels wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Hunter look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's acting.  I think she set it up to be alone with him because she wanted him to come on to her. (beat) I think maybe she's upset that he didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe she thought that was what she wanted and she got a little more than she bargained for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line I get on this guy, is that he's done half the women in Blue Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make him a child rapist. (beat) There's something else.  This girl's had some problems.  Wrecked a couple of her mom's cars.  Ran away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked Juvenile in Dade County for three years.  We had a missing persons on Kelly Van Ryan for two weeks... Maybe a year ago... The family kept it out of the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would make it about the time of her old man's suicide.  You don't think that could explain some erratic behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, I think we should go slow here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter puts his hands together, thinking.  He looks from Gloria, than back to Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a full-scale investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that will mean for Lombardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.  You heard that girl's statement.  I think he's dirty.  Get me a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria and Ray watch as Hunter gets up and leaves the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you were a big help.  You know what's going to happen if we go full-bore on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our job, Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter's making it our job because Sandra Van Ryan's got a bug up his ass. You know that as well as I do. (beat) We're gonna trash this guy's life and I keep asking myself if it's really necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray thinks this over.  He continues to study the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, maybe you're wrong about him.  Maybe he's got it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray takes notes, talks with neighbors, kids, lawn mower m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria talks with students -- Jimmy, Nicole, others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits at his desk, toying with a pencil.  He watches s pass -- no smiles, no waves, an occasional dark look. Through the press of students Sam sees Art at the door of office.  The two men look at one another.  At which point Gloria, followed by Ray, steps INTO SCENE.  The detective hands with Art.  As Art turns to close the door, Sam fall his line of vision.  Art looks away.  The door swings shu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky has begun to color.  Art Maddox stands on the gra the end of the channel separating the slips, watching as. A lone sailboat tacks toward the school. ANGLE ON BOAT - SAM & JIMMY Sam drops his sail, leaving himself just enough momentum cruise expertly into the little channel then into the sli Art watches as Jimmy jumps from the boat, ties it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, Jimbo.  I'll see you on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy hesitates, he wants to say something.  Sam waves hi Jimmy gives Art a hard look and heads for the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Art, nodding after Jimmy) What's left of my sailing class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art studies the dock between his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly Van Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is accusing me of rape.  Jimmy told me.  Apparently I'm the last to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... I... (a long beat) Sandra Van Ryan's been on the horn with every member of the school board all day long.  She's pushing for suspension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can tell you Sam, is hang in there.  They clear you of this mess, you get reinstated, with back pay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.  I'll just tell my creditors I'm not a rapist.  No problem... Shit. (beat) I can't believe the board's going to act without even hearing my side of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van Ryan family created Blue Bay. They built the school... Sandra Van Ryan calls up the board and says kiss my ass, they say, left, right, or in the middle. (beat) You're gonna need some help on this one, Sam.  You're gonna need a lawyer, and he'd better be a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical of its kind -- a Blockbuster Video, a 7-Eleven, h dozen small businesses, one of which, sandwiched between shop and the Mongolian Beef Bowl, bears the sign:  "KEN B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits in a cramped waiting room, leafing through a mag An attractive young SECRETARY sits a few feet away, behin desk.  Her PHONE RINGS.  She picks it up, then turns to S favoring him with a flirtatious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bowden will see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken Bowden, a slightly oily-looking young man in a nice s a large, padded neck brace, rises to shake Sam's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, hey, it's been a while. (beat) Looked for you at the ten year reunion. You missed out.  Three days at the Disneyworld Hotel... Partied ourselves silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of your old flames were there. You remember Jill, with the knockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken holds his hands out in front of his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blew up like the Goodyear blimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But check this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Ken.  I'm in some trouble.  I need an attorney and you're the only one I know. So I figured I'd start here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken stops, puts on a serious face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you did.  And I'm sorry. (folding his hands before him) Why don't you tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at him.  He starts to speak, then checks himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to your neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken puts a hand to his throat, as if aware of the brace f first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh this... chiropractor did a number on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the brace off, tossing it on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really have to wear the thing all the time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy from the insurance was here. Ken smiles.  Sam looks slightly ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Sam.  Shoot.  Let's see what we've got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trendy nouveau.  A valet parks Sam's Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks across a tiled entry.  He looks tired, but smil the maitre d'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgie, hey.  I'm meeting Barbara.  She here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE looks stiff, maybe a little nervous.  Sam picks up He scans the room...

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Dimly-lit, crowded, but we PICK OUT Barbara, stunning in delicate white sun dress, tanned arms resting upon a tabl Sam starts toward her.  George reaches out to touch his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lombardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam ignores him, threading his way among the people at a bar, then stopping short as he sees who Barbara is with - father, Tom Baxter. Tom Baxter sees Sam, gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not appropriate Lombardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps to one side, makes eye contact with Barbara. Barbara has tears in her eyes.  She looks at Sam, then sh head, looking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finished in Blue Bay, Lombardo. You've been scratching at the door long enough... (as Sam faces him) I ever see you around my daughter, you're going to be finished, period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men square off, but already we can SEE Georgie, t by a pair of beefy characters in blue blazers making thei across the room. Sam sees them too.  He takes a final look at Barbara.  Wh refuses to meet his eye, he pushes past Baxter, through t and out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red neon identifies it as Jim's Recovery Room.  A handful trucks sit in a dirt parking lot, Sam's Jeep among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is thick with smoke.  Locals shoot pool.  The wal decorated with dusty fishing nets and inflated blowfish. An aging BARMAID -- good-looking -- once, runs a rag arou pitcher, looks down the bar, smiles, finding... Sam, alone, awaiting service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, honey... Haven't seen you in a while.  How's life treatin' you? (off Sam's look) That bad, huh?  Well, you came to the right place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks outside.  He stands in the red glow of neon lig looking toward the road... On the opposite side of which. ... sits a sorry little collection of whitewashed stucco bungalows, identified by a green neon sign as the Glades Beyond the motel are the Everglades, a great expanse of d Sam stares at the motel.  At last he gets in his Jeep.  A EXITS the lot, a second pair of headlights flashes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted two-lane road cuts through the swamp.  Trees b with moss appear as ghostly shapes in the lights of Sam's

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: San drives -- a tired face.  Soft MUSIC on the RADIO. Something APPEARS in the road, caught for a moment in the headlights.  Sam swerves, whirls his head around, sees... A GATOR sliding of the shoulder and into the murky water. Sam lets out some air, relaxing a bit, then catches sight something else -- Headlights finding reflection in his re mirror, coming fast.  Sam watches as the lights get close looks back to the road -- an approaching curve... Sam is into the curve when the lights catch him.  A black Rover moves out to pass, then turns suddenly into Sam's l cutting him off. It happens quickly.  Sam swerves to avoid hitting the lar but the road affords little margin for error. The JEEP slides across a narrow shoulder, then plummets d steep embankment, CRASHING through cattails, rolling over BACK DOWN on its tires in a swampy gulch. Sam slumps back from the steering wheel.  Somewhere over he can see headlights shining into the trees. He hears a CAR DOOR SLAM, the SOUNDS of someone scramblin the embankment. Sam tries to get out of his seat harness.  Someone is approaching, splashing through the muck.  Suddenly a hand through the broken driver's window, helping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands get him loose.  Sam stumbles from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to find -- Frankie Condo, looming over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Sam, pulling him OUT OF FRAME.  What we are left the SOUND of FISTS THUDDING INTO FLESH -- then Sam, hitti hood of his Jeep, slumping down into the muck. Frankie is breathing hard.  We HEAR him SLOGGING back up embankment.  We HEAR a DOOR SLAM, the RANGE ROVER driving leaving only darkness, and the EERIE SOUNDS of the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazzling light.  Sam's smashed-up Jeep is parked before K Bowden's office, next door to the Mongolian Beef Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Ken eye one another over a green plastic table -- with his neck brace, Sam with a bruised face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured, you know, it would be darker in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves a hand to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tie whoever did it to Sandra Van Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady has some deep pockets.  That's all I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how deep her pockets are, Ken.  I thought I might be able to save my fucking house with an equity loan. Guess who's on the board of directors at the bank?

They're still shoveling dirt and my guess is, they're coming up empty.  Now tell me I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.  I think we covered this.  I told her I was going to call a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

I figured she was probably there but that she was angry and didn't want to be found.  I don't know... Maybe I should have called.  But it's not like Kelly can't take care of herself.  I figured we'd just take it up on Monday, in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Same with the kids.  They saw her running down the street, but that's it. (beat) With no physical evidence, what do we have?  Her word against his.

dialogues.text: Ray and Gloria drive through the Everglades, past marshla punctuated by thick stands of melaluca trees.

What did you say?

dialogues.text: You and Suzie used to come out here together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sometimes.  Lots of the kids hang out here. (beat) You really think something bad happened to Suzie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the question) Lombardo ever come out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks at him, surprised, sees that Ray is serious. the idea generates a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say something funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I mean... just the idea that Mr. Lombardo would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way I hear it, he was pretty tight with the kids, one of the guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off as Ray kneels over a big flat rock.  Ray br away some sand, drapes the sport coat over his arm, takin tweezers and latex gloves from the pockets. Jimmy moves closer, curious, seeing what Ray sees.

dialogues.speaker: GLOVED HANDS
dialogues.text: as tweezers pick up two teeth from a crevice in the stone Ray straightens, holding the teeth in the palm of his han Jimmy stares at the teeth. Ray takes a couple of bills from his pocket, hands them t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be staying here, Jimmy. You can catch a bus up there at the lot, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks a little sick, but he takes the money.  He st toward the lot. Ray watches for a moment.  Then calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People aren't always what they appear to be, kid.  Remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks at him, trying to make sense of what Ray is s clearly disturbed by the implications.  But he asks no mo questions.  He turns, trudging alone back through the san

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEETH go into a plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Black-and-whites, county cars -- police tape across the s Ray, Gloria and Hunter watch as DAVE MERRITT, a forensic bags the teeth.  He passes the bag to Ray, then bends to rocks where he begins to take a blood sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonbardo and Kelly killed her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter and Gloria exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two kids could've gotten into a fight, lost a couple of teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are Suzie Toller's teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swamp, most likely... Lombardo's a swamp rat, knows the body will never be found there.  But he's made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the evidence bag containing the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her grandmother said she'd been threatening to run away.  And I found the car at the Miami bus terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think Sam could've put it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust it for prints.  My guess is, if anybody murdered Suzie it was probably that little sociopath Kelly Van Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shakes his head; he turns to Dave, still working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon can we get something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get blood type right away. Dental records will take longer.  You want DNA, that can take weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nods, looks out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor dumb Suzie, she never had a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that, Ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns to her -- an intense look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's next, Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ice cold) Get off this Ray, now. (beat) If there is any evidence here, it's for Homicide. (turning to Dave) You get an ID, you call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods.  Hunter stalks off toward his car.  Ray turns Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do me one favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, you heard him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I'm right, Gloria?  What if I'm right and Hunter's wrong? (beat) What do you do if you see a bad thing coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria looks toward the highway, trying to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick with me on this Gloria.  I need you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the teeth aren't Suzie's?  You'll give this up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm wrong about those teeth -- it's a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's Jeep -- a "FOR SALE" sign in the window -- sits in Across the road -- Gloria sits in the white Taurus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray sits in his truck, picks up his cellular, punches in number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaker) Merritt, Forensics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teeth doin' any talkin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray.  Stop calling.  I told you the dental records will take time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Could be hers.  Types match.  Could be a lot of other people's too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Second you get something on those teeth, I want it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray hangs up without waiting for a reply.  He turns to th Ryan house, an orange light slanting across its facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria waits in her car.  She looks toward the motel. Sam's Jeep is parked before one of the bungalows.  There light on in the room.  We can SEE inside. Gloria sighs, picks up a pair of binoculars and trains th the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Suitcases and boxes are stacked everywhere.  Sam, bare-ch in khaki slacks, moves about the room.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: watching Sam, as...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The PHONE has begun to RING.  Sam looks at it until it st then picks it up and dials a number.  Kelly answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I've been calling you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY/SAM PHONE CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: Kelly is in the guest house, pacing in front of the gun c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really serious.  That cop, he keeps watching me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duquette.  Forget him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it.  He gives me the creeps... I mean why was Suzie so scared of him?  She's not that way.  I think he did something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he got her busted for possession...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I think it was something else... Suzie says the bust was bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you believe her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat -- a sigh) I don't know. (beat) I want to see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly... Relax.  Take one of your mom's valium or something.  In another week you get on the plane.  It's over.  We're rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if they find out... God, they'd put you in the gas chamber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is about to respond, then looks out the window, sees. ACROSS THE STREET, the white Taurus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if they're tapping your phone, we're dead.  Stay in the guest house.  Skip the graduation parties.  You'll never see Duquette.  Okay?  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay.  I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees the light go out in Sam's room, lowers her binocular for a moment, then begins to write something on a pad. She's still at it when something KNOCKS at a FENDER.  She up, startled, to find... Sam in the street, still shirtless, his arms and shoulder back-lit by the neon light of the Glades Motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that against the law, peeking into windows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) Suzie Toller is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lets out his breath, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't cone home last night.  We found her car at the bus terminal, but nothing to suggest she bought a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she used another name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray thinks she was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could tell me where you were last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddannit... I don't have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops himself, calms down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.  I want you to see something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria hesitates, looks up at Sam, then puts down the pho opens her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Gloria walk among the boxes and suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods.  He goes to one of his cardboard filing boxes, out a file, hands it to Gloria.  As she takes it, he goes closet, takes a shirt from a hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's file.  Read it.  You're going to find an angry, sexually confused girl who's made threats on her mother's life and a female lover she'd never identify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me Ray thinks Suzie was killed.  I don't have to ask you who he thinks did it, do I? (beat) All I'm saying is, read that, you'll have a new perspective on things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria sits on the bed, the file in her hand.  She watche pulls on the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us about this before the trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holds her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- I still had ethical standards to protect.  They meant a lot to me.  Now, I don't care.  And no amount of money can buy that back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is interrupted by the HONKING of a HORN.  He looks ou

dialogues.speaker: LOT
dialogues.text: A taxi waits in the glow of the green neon. Sam looks down on Gloria, seated on his bed, her skirt sh enough to REVEAL shapely legs.  For a moment the two hold another's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ride.  If you're not planning on arresting me, that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.  Ray picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray.  What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: RAY/GLORIA PHONE CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: She's still in Sam's room, the file spread across the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired, Ray.  I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lombardo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's leaving the country.  And I don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood type on the rocks matches Suzie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Homicide's job now, Ray, let 'em do it.  I'll tell you something else, there's more to this story than you know, Ray... If Suzie is dead, I think Hunter may be on the right track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray clicks off his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray? (nothing but dial tone) Shit.  Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gets out of his car, presses the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Detective Duquette, Ms. Van Ryan.  Let me in.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. POOL & JACUZZI - NIGHT Ray CROSSES the deck, Sandra at his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she lives.  In the guest house. Now will you tell me what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm placing your daughter under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning, cutting her off) Suzie Toller is dead.  You don't want Kelly to be next, then take my advice. Stay out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cap and gown lay strewn on the sofa. Kelly wears jeans and a bra.  She looks up to see Ray mov across the tile.  Her eyes go wide, then move to the gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra stands near the jacuzzi, not exactly sure what to watching as...

dialogues.speaker: GUEST HOUSE
dialogues.text: Ray knocks at the French door.  It swings open.  He steps A long moment, then VOI?ES, the SOUND of things being kno about, BREAKING GLASS. Sandra starts toward the house then stops at the SOUND of single GUNSHOT. A SECOND GUNSHOT follows, then a THIRD. The guest house door opens.  Ray stumbles out, his should bloody, a .357 in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEOTAPE
dialogues.text: We SEE him from the waist up -- a white T-shirt, his shou bandaged, his arm in a sling.  There are red scratch mark face.  His eyes look blankly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up.  I lost control of the situation, the one thing they train you for... God, what did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell us what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Kelly Van Ryan she was under arrest for conspiracy and murder.  I did her rights.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Perfect crescent of sand.  A man in white shorts reclines beach chair, beneath a gaily-colored umbrella, sipping a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly went crazy, started screaming.  I grabbed her, put her on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Sam, in white shorts, looking good, watches a beautiful i girl in a thong bikini frolic in the surf. She seems to sense Sam watching, turns toward the beach. eyes meet Sam's.  She breaks into a beautiful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit, scratched.  But I had her pinned. She calmed down.  I was going to cuff her... She said she thought she was going to be sick.  She asked to use the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the island girl sit at an outdoor table.  The gir a short, terry cloth robe, Sam the white shorts and a flo shirt.  They sip drinks.  Their eyes meet.  Their fingers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her I was coming with her.  She nodded, like she understood.  We stood up together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't cuff her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looked shaky, but lucid.  I thought, I would just go with her, stand at the door... (shaking his head) I think I looked away.  A split second. Then, bingo.  Just like that.  She puts a knee into my groin. (beat) There was this coffee table between us and the wall.  She got one foot on that thing and launched herself at the gun case.  Thing had a glass door.  I could hear it breaking. (beat) I didn't go down, but she slowed me up, just enough.  Before I could get to her, she'd turned on me with this small caliber handgun.  I yelled at her to put it down.  She got off a shot.  I took it in the shoulder.  I... I had no choice. I returned fire.  Two rounds, I think. In the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence, save for the BUZZING of the MACHINE. number of plainclothes police, Hunter and Gloria among th watch the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went there to protect her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs his head, then looks up, his eyes focusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teeth, were they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie Toller's.  And that's the only thing saving your sorry ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant sun on turquoise water.  A few boats anchored i lagoon.  A quiet place. Heading out -- a forty-foot sloop, Sam at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria, Baxter, a tearful Sandra, sit in seats, watch as Ray stands before a panel, A SUIT, A CHIEF in uniform, Hu Ray wears a suit, his hair neatly trimmed.  His arm is no in a sling, but one of his hands is still bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Duquette; our investigation concludes that this was a good shooting. But that's irrelevant.  You were not assigned to this case -- whatever you imagined this case to be.  And now two young women are dead.  You are terminated with forfeiture of pension and benefits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at the floor. Hunter coughs.  His hands rest on a file -- we SEE the vi cassette inside -- labeled "TOLLER/VAN RYAN -- CONFIDENTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie Toller's teeth and blood were found near the area known as Stoner Rocks.  Suzie's blood was found in the Van Ryan Range Rover.  This, in conjunction with evidence obtained by Detectives Duquette and Perez has led this office to the conclusion that Susan Marie Toller was murdered by Kelly Lanier Van Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra chokes back a sob.  She gets to her feet, to be le the room by Tom Baxter. Gloria Perez watches, a sad look in her eye, then turns t at Ray.  His back is to her -- the broad shoulders, expen suit.  His hands are clasped behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria stands among a considerable number of mourners.  S just back from Sandra and Tom Baxter, who, in turn, are j from the open grave. As Gloria watches, Sandra looks off to the side, where so catches her eye.  Gloria sees her start, then follows her

dialogues.speaker: CEMETERY
dialogues.text: On a rise some fifty yards from the Van Ryan plot, two pe stand near an old oak -- Ruby and Walter. When Gloria looks back at Sandra, it seems to her as if t has slumped against Tom Baxter, who now stares at the two on the rise as if, by doing so with sufficient intensity, might make them disappear. Gloria turns to the grave site, her eye lingers on the op grave, then moves to the huge marker which dominates the family plot and, in fact, the entire scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angel Gabriel, trumpet in hand, carved in relief upon obelisk of black marble.  Beneath the angel is a carved s and upon it the words: "I AM THE RESURRECTION AND THE LIFE," and below that:  "W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam Lombardo walks along a moonlit lagoon, headed toward bungalow. The bungalow is simple, picturesque -- whitewashed walls, thatched roof.  A patio opens onto the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam steps in off the sand, he sees something and stops Wet spots lead toward the bungalow. Sam listens.  Everything is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam ENTERS in a room lit only by the blue light of a larg aquarium.  He listens once more, hears it -- RUNNING WATE He moves down a short hallway, observes the light which s from beneath a bedroom door.  He pushes it open, goes ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CROSSES the room. The bathroom door is ajar, the room leaking steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps inside, looks at the shower stall -- an indisti shape moves there in the steam. San watches, then jerks open the shower door.  The steam clears -- REVEALING a tall, athletic body, and now the fa Ray Duquette, grinning at Sam out of the swirling steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  I wasn't expecting you 'til tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns off the water, steps out of the stall, wrapping in a towel.  There's a fresh, raised scar across one shou Ray winces a little as he tucks the towel about his waist looks at himself in the mirror, touching the scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice girlfriend you had there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you fixed that. (beat) What the hell happened, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitch shot me, is what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head, walks back into the bedroom.  Ray fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what did you want me to do, die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, you're the cop, they don't teach you to disarm people, shoot them in the leg or something?  You weren't supposed to kill her for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Ray just looks at Sam, his eyes narrowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you become squeamish about these things before or after you bludgeoned little Suzie Toller to death with a wine bottle? (off Sam's silence) Jesus, man. It couldn't have worked out better. They're convinced Kelly whacked Suzie. I can't talk 'em out of it. (beat) We should be celebrating.  This thing worked out just like you said, only better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly was supposed to be framed, not killed. (beat) What I'm telling you is, I don't like surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray walks to a dresser where a bottle of champagne sits i bucket of ice.  He opens the bottle, fills two glasses. one of the glasses to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every cloud has a silver lining, partner.  Here's to no loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his glass in a toast. Sam looks at it, then raises his glass as well.  Ray smil doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to no more surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shrugs.  The two men's eyes meet.  They touch glasses drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Ray work on the deck of Sam's sloop, stowing gear loading supplies. The boat's mast shines in the sunlight before a brilliant Palms sway.  The men work in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria drives up in the white Taurus.  She parks before t ramshackle old building and the gator pen. Walter is in the pen.  Ruby stands just outside of it.  S toward the road as Gloria gets out, then back to the pen. Gloria comes down the bank to stand beside Ruby.  She's j time to see the huge old reptile raise itself, hissing, o front legs, jaws sprung wide.  The women watch as Walter his arm into the gator's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gator can't see what's in front of it for shit.  They see out the sides. (beat) That one don't even know Walter's arm's in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if something distracts it and it snaps anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess Walter can kiss that arm of his goodbye. (loud enough for Walter to hear) He don't use it for no good deeds anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at the ladies, picks up the stick and sweeps between the gaping jaws, which snap in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come all the way out here to watch Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Suzie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was wondering if I might ask you about Ray Duquette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) He used to come around here.  He had a thing going with one of the girls over at the Glades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby nods toward the motel, a bitter smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got sort of hung up on her, from what hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still work there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not after that night. (a long beat) I don't know what happened.  Maybe he caught her with some john... All I know is, the next morning the girl was gone and there was a dead boy... Indian kid named Davy.  Used to live down the road there in a wrecked car. Him and Suzie were at the Glades that night. (beat) It was right after that, Ray got Suzie busted and sent her away.  That's what there is to say about Ray Duquette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there ever any kind of investigation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby cuts her off with a short laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duquette always claimed the kid was dusted, came after him with a knife. But it was Jack's Fish Camp... This could be the moon for all most people care. (a long beat) Wasn't supposed to be like that though. This place was supposed to be something once.  There were going to be roads and houses.  There was going to be a town. They were going to call it Salt Creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the surface of the sea -- the emerald island in the distance.  The bow of the sloop comes INTO FRAME. On board -- Sam stands in the cockpit, at the helm.  Ray on the deck.  The boat sails easily before the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray... you see that winch by your head? Take a couple of turns on it for me, she's luffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray cranes his neck to look at the winch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we call it a winch. (pointing at pieces of the rigging) And these are shrouds, and these are stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was supposed to be a vacation.  Why didn't you buy a nice big power boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man.  I'll make a sailor out of you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, or get me drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray kneels.  He begins to tighten the winch. Sam watches him for a moment, then reaches around behind to unhook the short line which holds the boom. The mainsail catches wind, swinging the boom in a wide ar directly at Ray. Ray looks up, sees it coming just in time to catch it on The blow is enough to send him sprawling through the life where he just manages to grab one of the nylon cords. Sam ducks as the boon continues to swing erratically abov deck, watching as Ray hauls himself on board. The boat no longer driven by the wind, bobs up and down o small ground swell. The two men face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man... You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That how you planned it?  You take cut Suzie, get me to hang it on Kelly, then dump me in the ocean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come off it, man... It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nods, then reaches down, pulls off the winch handle a starts with it toward Sam. Sam looks around.  He jerks open a storage compartment. diver's weight belt tumbles out.  Sam grabs it, swings it his head in circles, letting the weight pick up momentum, preparing to throw. Ray crouches, still brandishing the winch handle.  The bo sweeps the deck. Sam throws the belt. Ray grabs a shroud, dances out of the way, then steadies a mean grin spreading across his face. There's no tine for Sam to look for anything else. Ray moves quickly across the deck -- a menacing sight -- well-muscled, the handle gleaming in his hand. Sam pulls himself out of the cockpit.  Ray jumps in.  But as far as he gets. WHOOSH -- A spear pierces Ray's thigh.  He screams, goes the handle skittering across the deck. Ray follows it with his eyes, reaching out, then freezing sees something else.  He draws in his hand as if bitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scuttles backward, pulling himself onto the deck, clut his leg which squirts blood as if an artery has been seve But his eyes never leave the hatchway leading belowdecks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead... for godsake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat heels over.  The spear in Ray's thigh bangs agai edge of the cockpit.  He grimaces in pain as... Suzie Toller steps up from belowdecks.  She's wearing a b and showing a nice tan.  She's carrying Sam's new spear g fresh spear at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumors of my demise have been greatly exaggerated. (to Sam) Nice move.  Good thing I was here to save your incompetent ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam secures the boom.  Ray stares at Suzie, his face twis some combination of pain, rage and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... I should've killed you myself. should never have left it up to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda, coulda, woulda... (to Sam) Get him in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San starts for Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, for Christ's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's feet slide in the bloody smear.  He stops. Ray clings to a safety line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH -- A second spear penetrates Ray's shoulder.  He l grip.  The boat heels over, dumping Ray into the water. Suzie puts down her spear gun.  She goes to a storage loc takes out a bait bucket.  She steps up on the deck. Ray is floating not far from the boat, the water going re him.  He calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, for godsake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ray.  Guess whose name is on the numbered bank account besides yours and Sam's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises the bucket, heaves bloody chum into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like these joint survivorship accounts.  Something unfortunate happens to one of the signatories, the others don't have to worry.  Are you worrying, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heaves more chum -- a big red slurp across Ray's face Ray gasps, goes under, thrashing around in the red slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men, use 'em abuse 'em lose 'em.

dialogues.speaker: SHARKS
dialogues.text: from underwater, in a frenzy, rip a human body into a blo cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie cones up from below with a champagne bottle and gla already filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gazes out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was about as grim as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy was history when he killed Kelly.  You knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you knew what he was like all along... Maybe his killing Kelly was a thing you had counted on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then it is better this way, don't you think?  No loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the same thing Ray said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie smiles -- showing the big gap where her two front t used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Ray. (a beat) Come on Sam, we did it.  We put the screws to the Van Ryans.  We won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands a glass to Sam, takes the other.  He puts it to lips, suddenly hesitates, thinks, sniffs the glass. A moment.  Suzie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about paranoid.  Now are you gonna teach me to sail this big old boat or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam downs his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Grab that winch there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie gives him a pouty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the winch.  I wanna drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Come here and take the helm. I'll get the winch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie gives him her best, gap-toothed smile, then comes f to take the gleaming chrome wheel, as Sam scrambles up on kneeling where Ray had kneeled before him to set the jib. Suzie watches -- a long beat, then, slowly reaches behind unhooking the line which holds the boom...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: sweeping the deck -- coming right at us, blotting out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria sits on Suzie's bed, books spread out around her. stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked if Suzie knew about the Salt Creek land deal?  Girl read every book she could find on it, the Van Ryans too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby takes a photo album from among the books, opens it, photograph on the bed.  It is one we have seen before.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: A stately old gentleman in a three-piece suit.  White hai white handlebar mustache.  A derby on his knee, a walking at his side.  He stares out at the world from a high-back wicker chair, flanked by potted palms and two small terri Across the bottom of the picture is the name -- "WILLIAM VAN RYAN."  And beside that, in another hand -- "Dear old

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't enough Van Ryan had to destroy the people who invested here.  He got to be old, he and his rich cronies would come down here, hunt and whore, act like assholes.  One trip he showed up with this young girl he'd picked up somewhere, gotten her pregnant then dumped her in the swamp. (indicating the photo) That came with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had it, before she drank herself to death.  Wasn't exactly a love child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie. (beat) Then you're not her grandmother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raised her like she was, but no, Walter's my only child. (beat) He was a good boy, till the army took him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria looks once more at the old photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Suzie and Sandra Van Ryan were half- sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other girl, Kelly.  Suzie's niece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria stands, a little weary.  Ruby walks her from the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for talking to me, Ruby.  I am sorry about Suzie, she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have gotten to the main room and Gloria stops short, noticing for the first time that the beat-up old black-an TV has been replaced by a high-tech, giant-screen televis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  Nice TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady nods, walks her outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dusty road, the little dock, the gator pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old saying from the Everglades -- virtue may be missed but sin can't hide. (a long beat) Folks pay in the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria nods.  She is distracted by a movement in the gato

dialogues.speaker: PEN
dialogues.text: For a moment there is nothing more than a few ripples acr surface of the pond which lies inside the pen, then, slow GATOR'S EYES -- cold, reptilian, unblinking, rising up to across the oily waters.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK. CREDITS...
dialogues.text: for about ten seconds, enough to fool the audience, then. INTERCUT - LIKE OUTTAKES... ... PIECES OF SCENES WE COULDN'T SEE, or SCENES WE DIDN'T ALL, in reverse chronological order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is frantically trying to unlock the gun case as Ray through the French doors.  She can't get it done.  He's t an instant. She screams, backs away, then watches as Ray stops, wraps around his hand and breaks the glass. He takes out a small caliber handgun, checks the clip, ai gun at his own shoulder and fires. BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jeep and a truck parked in the mud.  Sam and Ray meet u heavy, moss-draped cypress.  Sam hands Ray a plastic bag teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the place I'm talking about -- the big rocks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM & SUZIE behind the big rocks.  He's got vise-grip pliers jammed i mouth.  Suzie moans, for real.  He loosens his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the pressure too tight. You'll crush the fucking evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes a breath, prepares to try again.  Suzie pops a of pills with gulps of wine.  Sam goes to it once more. BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Sam on the floor, naked.  He's on her from the It's getting wild.  He suddenly stops, rolls to the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta stop.  I'm gonna come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly laughs, straddles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That never seemed to worry you at the Glades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) I love you.  Now give me the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whiny voice) No little girl can ever make me come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie's VW is parked across the street, in the shadows of trees.  She and Sam sit inside, watching as... Ray Duquette EXITS a bungalow, a sport coat over his arm. heads for Jim's Recovery Room.  In another moment, a youn in a leather miniskirt walks out of the same bungalow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to like some of the same places you do.  Funny you never met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, real funny.  You're wrong about this, I could get busted on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, the guy's dirty.  He'll like it.  Especially the part about offing me. (beat) Now get out of here.  Go make yourself a new friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is at the bar.  Sam sits down next to him.  A moment silence, the twang of a country JUKE BOX -- then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: ZNT. SAM'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Suzie Toller framed in the doorway.  She walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like bein' a caddy for rich kids' problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you out there in your old air boat, thinking about what might have been, old man Van Ryan hadn't fucked you out of it. (beat) What if I told you I had a way we could get a big piece of it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd need the famous Lombardo charm, not that you'd have to do anything you haven't done already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes an envelope from her notebook, tosses it in fro Sam.  Pictures slide onto his desk -- Sam and Kelly -- in poses of coked-out debauchery at the Glades Motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (white-faced) How...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.  He's been aimin' that Brownie through knotholes for years.  I saw these, I knew he'd finally struck gold. (beat) I can't decide which came out better, that little straw Kelly's got up her nose, or that vibrator you've got up her ass.  What do you think, Mr. Lombardo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) I think there's some things you do, you don't want to see yourself doing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK -- MORE CREDITS -- then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lounges in a booth.  He looks hot, bored.  He stirs a Kelly walks in out of the light.  She is looking a little out, a big straw bag slung over one shoulder, but oh, so skimpy cutoffs and cowboy boots -- long legs flashing as nears Sam's booth.  Sam looks up, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) You think that's wise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting next to him) Um-huh.  And guess what else? (reaching into her bag) I have toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a snail bag of white powder, taps out a lin table top. Sam looks at it.  He looks at Kelly.  He's had a few drin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) Well, Z guess one taste wouldn't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS.
dialogues.text: The seal comes up.  It's over.  They head for the lobby -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria stands beneath the jawbones, looking toward the ch the shadows lengthen across the dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: CHANNEL
dialogues.text: Walter hangs a "FOR SALE" sign on a small, shabby sloop. Gloria CROSSES the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling your boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was Suzie's boat.  Guess she won't be needin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have guessed Suzie was a sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter finishes with the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old lady had her tested once.  They said her IQ was way up there, round two hundred or some such shit. (beat) That girl could do just about anything, she put her mind to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria has nothing to say.  She stares at the little sloo bobbing in the muddy water of the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: SEA LEVEL
dialogues.text: A head bobs among the groundswells.

dialogues.speaker: SAM LOMBARDO
dialogues.text: sucking wind through a smashed face, struggling to stay a as... ... in the distance, the sloop races toward a far horizon

dialogues.speaker: SLOOP
dialogues.text: Suzie, at the helm, looking good, face to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really)
